gengine

Class GameManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gengine.GameManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.Observer

    public class GameManager
extends java.lang.Thread
implements java.util.Observer
    This is the manager class where overall logic of the game is handled.
    Version:
    0.2
    Author:
    Lauri Pirttimaki

      • GameManager

        public GameManager()
        The default constructor. Sets up gameOver, player and list of other game objects.

        public long getDeltaTime()
        Returns the substraction of currentTime and previousTime.
        Returns:
        time elapsed since last time in nanosecods

        Method adds gameManager as observer to all non-BLOCK objects.
        Parameters:
        objects - - all related objects

      • getMap

                   javafx.scene.image.Image... sprite)
        Method that creates and relocates map objects.

        sprite - - the image you want to use for the mapping.

      • draw

        public void draw(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
        Root drawing method for game objects. It calls draw method from all the objects.
        Parameters:
        gc - - object used for drawing to canvas.

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        This method starts the game loop.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable o,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        The observing update method. When collectable is picked up its value is added to score and then it is remove from the list of objects.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        o - - Observable object
        arg - - notify argument of Observable object

      • updateGame

        public void updateGame(long delta)
        Method is the master method for game logic handling. Calls for all the other update methods in objects and tracks state of the game.
        Parameters:
        delta - - time between frames

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Method checks whether any game ending conditions are met. Currently checks if player has any health left.
        Returns:
        true if player has 0 health.

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is the main game loop. Calls for updateGame method frequently.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
